title: Drawing, "End Table", August 1, 1933
medium: Graphite on tracing paper, double ruled border in graphite
markings: Stamps: Stamp in red ink at lower right: DONALD DESKEY/ 145 WEST 57TH STREET/ NEW YORK CITY
inscribed: Inscribed in graphite at lower left: 6/1 B.P. TO W. 8/1/33; inscribed dimensions, instructions, materials throughout; inscribed in graphite at upper right: 19 WOOD/ 22 BAK; inscribed in graphite in lower right margin: SCALE 1 1/2"=1'0"/#7319 [circled]; inscribed in red color pencil at lower right: P
description: Drawing for end table showing perspective, elevations and plans. Table has rectangular top of black bakelite atop a smaller walnut base; four rectangular legs of American walnut that support a platform/shelf below of black Bakelite. Feet of legs curve inward to support shelf.
